main_definition: Worth is a measure of the value, importance, or merit of something.

meanings_and_examples.example: Her hard work and dedication made her a person of great worth in the eyes of her colleagues.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The degree to which something is good, valuable, or beneficial
meanings_and_examples.example: Exercising regularly has become very important to me. It's worth every effort I put into it.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Sufficient to meet a requirement or satisfy an expectation
meanings_and_examples.example: This donation is not enough to cover the cost of rebuilding the school; we need something more worthwhile.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Having value as a standard of comparison for other items' value
meanings_and_examples.example: Gold has long been considered worth more than silver in most transactions.
